sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"普通的，普遍的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: common, ordinary, commonplace, general, usual, popular, universal
means: common ： 多用于指物，侧重很常见，不稀奇。
ordinary ： 用于物，指每天发生，十分平淡无奇；用于人，指无特别之处，很一般。
general ： 语气强于common，侧重大多如此，很少有例外情况。
usual ： 指常见常闻和常做的事或举动，强调惯常性。
popular ： 指适应大众爱好、需要，为大家所公认或接受。
universal与general同义，但语气较强，侧重对每个人或事物都适用，根本没有例外。

stems_affixes.word_buile: popul人民+ous……的→adj.人口稠密的;人口多的
popul人民[平民]+ace名词字尾→n.平民,大众
popular流行的+ity性质→n.大众性,通俗性
popularize大众化,推广+ation表名词→n.普及,推广,通俗化
popul人民+ation表名词→n.全体居民,人口

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使[某地]人口减少,减少人口
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,除去+popul人民[人口],+ate使……→去掉人口
popular流行的+ize……化,使……→v.[使]大众化,[使]普及,推广

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使人民居住于…中,使人口集中在…之中,移民于…
stems_affixes.word_buile: popul人民+ate使……→v.使人民居住于…中,使人口集中在…之中,移民于…
re一再+populate使人民重新居住于…→v.使人民重新居住于…

mean.mean: 受喜爱的；受欢迎的；当红的

sentence.cn: 在大众文化中，无数的书籍和电影都符合爱情故事的标准。
sentence.en: An endless number of books and movies qualify as love stories in popular culture.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语上海卷 完形填空 原文

means.word_mean: 大众化的;流行的;受欢迎的

entry.def: Something that is popular is enjoyed or liked by a lot of people.
entry.tran: 受喜爱的；受欢迎的；当红的

example.ex: This is the most popular ball game ever devised...
example.tran: 这是有史以来发明出的最受欢迎的球类运动。

example.ex: Chocolate sauce is always popular with youngsters.
example.tran: 巧克力酱总是深受年轻人的喜爱。

entry.def: Someone who is popular is liked by most people, or by most people in a particular group.

example.ex: He remained  the most popular politician in France...
example.tran: 他一直是法国最受人爱戴的政治家。

example.ex: He was not only talented but immensely popular with his colleagues.
example.tran: 他不仅才华横溢，而且深受同事的喜爱。

entry.def: Popular newspapers, television programmes, or forms of art are aimed at ordinary people and not at experts or intellectuals.
entry.tran: （报纸、电视节目、艺术形式等）通俗的，流行的，大众化的

example.ex: Once again the popular press in Britain has been rife with stories about their marriage.
example.tran: 英国通俗报刊又一次对他们的婚姻进行了铺天盖地的报道。

example.ex: ...one of the classics of modern popular music.
example.tran: 现代流行音乐的经典之一

entry.def: Popular ideas, feelings, or attitudes are approved of or held by most people.

example.ex: Contrary to popular belief, the oil companies can't control the price of crude...
example.tran: 与人们普遍的看法相反，石油公司并不能控制原油价格。

example.ex: The military government has been unable to win popular support...
example.tran: 军政府一直未能赢得广泛的支持。

entry.def: Popular is used to describe political activities which involve the ordinary people of a country, and not just members of political parties.

example.ex: The late President Ferdinand Marcos was overthrown by a popular uprising in 1986.
example.tran: 已故总统费迪南德·马科斯于1986年被民众起义赶下了台。

means.word_mean: 1. regarded with great favor, approval, or affection especially by the general public;

sentences.sentence: "cabbage patch dolls are no longer popular"

means.word_mean: 2. carried on by or for the people (or citizens) at large;
3. representing or appealing to or adapted for the benefit of the people at large;

sentences.sentence: "written for the popular press in plain nontechnical language"

means.word_mean: 5. (of music or art) new and of general appeal (especially among young people)

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'prevalent among the general public'): from Latin popularis, from populus 'people'. Sense 1 dates from the early 17th cent
